results.title: Eyes without a face
results.brief_description: Pierre Brasseur plays a surgeon who adopts extreme measures in his attempts to restore his daughter’s face (Edith Scob), horribly disfigured in a car crash. His obsessive efforts require him and his loyal assistant (Alida Valli) to kidnap young women and graft their features onto his daughter. Director Georges Franju and cinematographer Eugen Shuftan transform the pulp horror material into an eerie and surreal Cocteau-like nightmare. Eyes Without a Face has been remade twice by Spanish director Jess Franco, first as ‘The Awful Dr. Orloff’ and later as Faceless. Described by Franju as ‘an anguish film’, this film contains some haunting images, none more striking than Scob’s tortured eyes staring out from her stark, white expressionless mask. Music by Maurice Jarre. Based on a novel by Jean Redon. Also known as ‘The Horror chamber of Dr. Faustus’. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Eye Witness. No. 81
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Alvin Goldman, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items as follows: New Life for Ghost Town Miners: Aided by the provincial government, jobless mine workers of Alberta move from Nordegg and other abandoned coal-mining areas to obtain new work elsewhere in Canada. School for Frogmen: Officers and men of the Royal Canadian Navy’s Operational Diving Unit at Halifax undergo rigorous training courses to equip them for sub-surface duties.

results.title: Eye Witness. No. 56
results.creator_credit: Ronald Weyman, Felix Lazarus, Hector Lemieux, David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items as follows: Scottish Shepherd Tries New Pastures: A boost to Newfoundland’s wool and mutton trade is given by Robert Evans, Scottish shepherd and breeder who uses the province’s many acres of grazing land on the Avalon peninsula for a new and profitable industry. Outdoor Classrooms Help Children Catch Up: Children who have fallen behind in their studies find summer school easy to take when lessons are in the pleasant surroundings of Toronto’s High Park. Canadian Experts Help Arab Farmers: Bringing knowledge and skills from where they are known to where they are needed is the job of two Canadian agricultural experts working with the Food and Agriculture Organization in Iraq.

results.title: Eye on the reef
results.creator_credit: Tina Dalton, Neil O'Hare, David Hannan, Sunburnt Pictures and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: A unique exploration of the most incredible natural wonder on earth, Australia’s greatest living treasure, the Great Barrier Reef featuring both the microscopic and majestic creatures of the undersea world - giant whale sharks, ferocious moray eels, soaring manta rays, reef sharks and hatchling turtles. It reveals the beauty and behaviour of tiny reef creatures filmed in intimate detail; the clownfish, poisonous anemones, blind shrimps, goby, farming damsel fish and the bizzare sexual rituals of sea slugs. The climax is the incredible phenomena of mass coral spawning as the reef erupts in a frenzy of creation. Over 24 hours we experience the natural daily rhythm of the reef, from the quiet dappled dawn, the frenzied afternoon feeding, to the slow creeping danger of evening and the surreal beauty of the reef at night.

results.title: Eye of the tiger [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Tosca Looby, Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Artemis International, ScreenWest and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: In the Khao Yai National Park, Thailand, a concerted effort is underway by the Wildlife Conservation Society to save the dwindling population of tigers. 95% of the tiger population has disappeared in the past 100 years, and in the last three years, only two Indo-Chinese tigers have been sighted in Khao Yai with humans outnumbering the creatures by ten to one in a market in which trading in tiger products is as lucrative as trading in cocaine. Poachers present the biggest threat to tigers; the animals they kill are the tiger’s potential food source, the trees that are chipped part of their habitat. Years ago people inhabited the National Park, now they have been forced to move to the outer perimeters of the park and rely on illegal hunting in the forest for survival. The program also follows the undercover activities of a group of conservationists and law enforcement agents to curtail the illegal trade in tiger products, particularly in Chinatown, Bangkok.

results.title: Eye = L'oeil
results.creator_credit: Viviane Elnecave, Pierre Moretti and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Inwardly, eyes may be the windows of the soul, but when the gaze is directed outward, they become much more than organs for perceiving the world around - they become also an instrument of involvement in all of life’s drama. In this highly imaginative animation film, one disembodied eye (one is all that it takes) embarks on life’s adventures, entering into and disengaging from all the many passions, vicissitudes and conflicts that beset one’s course. Music by Maurice Blackburn and sound by Michel Descombes.

results.title: Extremities
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Burt Sugarman, Scott Rosenfelt, Michael Rosenblatt, George W. Perkins, Thomas Coleman and Atlantic Entertainment
results.brief_description: Attacked but unharmed by a masked assailant, Marjorie (Farrah Fawcett) lives in mortal fear that the unidentified man will strike again - especially since he knows where she lives. Her attacker (James Russo) breaks into her home again and subjects her to a night of terror and sexual humiliation, however Marjorie manages to turn the tables on him, knocking him unconscious and rendering him helpless. She is then faced with a major moral dilemma, should she turn him in to the police or should she mete out her own punishment, and if so, what would be a fitting form? This is a film about random violence and the focus of the movie is on the moral dilemma Marjorie faces, the depiction of graphic violence in the film is shocking at times, but a standout, harrowing performance by Farrah Fawcett makes it compulsive viewing.

results.title: Extreme art 2
results.brief_description: Further explorations in experimental music video from Western Europe. As in the first collection of “Extreme Art”, these industrial-electronic musicians use sound and images heavily influenced by European surrealism. In this volume many of the contributions show the influence of the acid- house music scene, with a greater use of sampling in the music and a greater reliance on computer animation in the video imagery. The collection spans across punk, industrial music, heavy metal and house to deliver music at the edge of chaos.

results.title: Extreme art
results.brief_description: This is a collection of Western European experimental music videos. Featuring collaborations between electronic composers and avant-garde image-makers, the artists in “Extreme Art” all share a commitment to an artistic expression the roots of which are to be found in surrealism and dada. The visual work combines computer animation, video collage, and super-8 film to present a menacing vision of technological society at the point of implosion. The music in this video ranges from minimalist electronic experimentation to bizarre combinations of indigenous ethnic music with computer simulated noise; to brooding, menacing industrial soundscapes. Though the artists represented in this music video sampler are all unique from one another, they are all uncompromising in their desire to produce work which unsettles and disturbs. NOTE: SOME OF THE VIDEO IMAGERY MIGHT BE DISTURBING. DO NOT ADJUST YOUR SET - SOME VIDEO SEGMENTS ARE DELIBERATELY UNSTABLE.

results.title: Exponents: a study in generalisation
results.creator_credit: Stephen Slocomb, Ray Redheffer, Ray Eames and Charles Eames
results.brief_description: Animated symbols are used to explain the powers of a number and the use of the exponent in expanded notation. This film has no dialogue and relies entirely on animated visual illustrations to define exponents.
